channel.title: Court Wizard Mechanics Question
channel.description:
I am trying to clarify some mechanics on the Court Wizard. - Barrier and Ice Ward. What do those look like to the person they are casted on? Do they get a message saying that it happened? or do they get a message if it was a successful protect? or no message at all? - What does barrier actually protect against? If it doesn't work on kills/ converts... then would it only work against role blocks/ drunk redirects/ hunter dogs?
I am making a "Fake Journal" Guide updated for current patch with some ideas and this is the last class I have some confusion about the feedback/ true capabilities of each ability.

item.title: Court Wizard Mechanics Question
item.dc:creator: Face_Hugger
item.description:
I wish CW barriers would let the protector know. I was in a long match with a CW protecting me, as a prince, and I had to go by only their word.

Read full topic

frame, mind warp (illusionist), defile I think

item.title: Court Wizard Mechanics Question
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
Barrier should protect against roleblocking, Sage’s firewall and Shock, Invoker’s mind control, Scorned’s Frame…

And

Uhh
…

Yeah, so Barrier is pretty fucking weak.

Read full topic

item.title: Court Wizard Mechanics Question
item.dc:creator: Alkander
item.description:
Ahh, I’ve gotten that notification before, so thats why. Makes sense.

Yea idk if it would prevent a dog from visiting, I feel like it wouldnt since its a “killer” ability

Read full topic

item.title: Court Wizard Mechanics Question
item.dc:creator: TryphonX
item.description:
Alkander:

Barrier and Ice Ward. What do those look like to the person they are casted on? Do they get a message saying that it happened? or do they get a message if it was a successful protect? or no message at all?

The person that has the ability used on them will not receive a notification. However, whoever tries to visit (in ice ward’s case) or use a negative effect (in Barrier’s case) will get this notification. Something prevented you from visiting <Player's Name>[Number] room last night (or something like that)

Alkander:

What does barrier actually protect against? If it doesn’t work on kills/ converts… then would it only work against role blocks/ drunk redirects/ hunter dogs?

I’m not exactly sure about that. I’d guess occupation.

Read full topic

item.title: Court Wizard Mechanics Question
item.dc:creator: Alkander
item.description:
I am trying to clarify some mechanics on the Court Wizard.

  • Barrier and Ice Ward. What do those look like to the person they are casted on? Do they get a message saying that it happened? or do they get a message if it was a successful protect? or no message at all?
  • What does barrier actually protect against? If it doesn’t work on kills/ converts… then would it only work against role blocks/ drunk redirects/ hunter dogs?

I am making a “Fake Journal” Guide updated for current patch with some ideas and this is the last class I have some confusion about the feedback/ true capabilities of each ability.
